job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Team atmosphere, great support from management, strong focus on patient care.
This is a company who consistently advocates for and provides quality and compassionate care; patients are number one, but staff quality of life and work/life balance are continuously stressed as just as important. This is a company where I feel like family. They are the only non profit hospice in Tucson, and support several other people around the area through their profits. I have experienced first hand caring for patietns who have no insurance and no means to pay. This is a company with a huge heart, and a non-profit mission that I am proud to be a part of. 
This is a place that you can feel comfortable working with for the long run.
cons: Remote work is not for everyone, home hospice care is definitely not for the faint of heart.

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: This is truly a patient care driven organization, dedicated to compassionate care. This is what motivates the team every day, based on the company core values. The company mission proved a great work culture. I deeply respect this values-based organization, and blessed to be a part of this team of dedicated professionals & compassionate servants to the community
cons: Although there are always things to improve in a company, I do not see specific cons to mention.

pros: I have over 38 years as a registered nurse working in many areas of health care.  In fact, I have worked all over this country as I have a compact state license.  I found this opportunity on Indeed while I was searching for a job that I could work as well as continue working on my Master's degree.  I can tell anyone with complete assurance that I have found the perfect job.  It's not even like a job.  The work is challenging and satisfying.  There is great autonomy and flexible scheduling.  It is just wonderful coming to work in such a supportive environment.
It is great to work with an organization who is sincere about wanting their employees to succeed
cons: I haven't experienced a con yet.

pros: Friendly authentic people, autonomy, trust, training, flexibility
cons: Really nothing I can think of
